Perfect!

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Rj 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 5:13 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] =
Re: I have a question.





        I didn't think you were being a smart a=
ss or anything.  I was just trying to be clear!



        --- On Wed, 5/20=
/09, April Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:


      =
    From: April Abercrombie <april@...>
          =
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.com
          Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 4:05 PM


          =EF=
=BB=BF 

          "I'm not trying to say I know how a spirit could record =
on an analog recorder, or if they can at all: my point was that it wasn't r=
easonable to assume it could directly change the bits on digital media and =
wind up with anything usable."

          I wasn't trying to be a smart ass=
, just in case that is what you were thinking. I really wanted to know. May=
be I should have phrased it "Do you know how it would work with analog?" I =
wasn't like "Oh yeah...how but that??!!!" LOL!!!


          "However, it m=
ay be that an EMF source strong enough to modify the signal would also effe=
ct all kinds of other things in the unit, including the final media itself.=
  It would be interesting for someone to determine what kind of external EM=
F is needed to induce or modify a signal in the pre-digital phase of the re=
cording circuitry, and what side effects that would have.  Depending on the=
 result, it could either reveal other ways to detect spirit influence, or p=
rove that no spirit influence (via EMF) is happening."

          Yes-it wo=
uld be very interesting. I already know first hand that errant EMF can effe=
ct my digital recorder. I had this happen on just our last case last weeken=
d.

          But tape would probably be different. It is true that we have=
n't had as many EVP's on analog as we get on our digitals. Maybe the ones w=
e get on our analogs are actually disembodied voice, created at a sound fre=
quency we can't hear with our ears. I was just talking with Jim about this =
very issue not too long ago.


            ----- Original Message ----- 
  =
          From: Rj 
            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
            S=
ent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 4:56 PM
            Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re:=
 I have a question.



                  I'm not trying to say I know how a=
 spirit could record on an analog recorder, or if they can at all: my point=
 was that it wasn't reasonable to assume it could directly change the bits =
on digital media and wind up with anything usable.

                  But, =
were I to conjecture, one might say that the air pressure of a voice is con=
verted to a signal that modifies the magnetic properties of a tape.  And a =
line recording uses a signal, not from the mic, but from some other source,=
 to do the same.  So if that signal were to be manipulated via external EMF=
, it would change the final result on the tape.  

                  Since =
we are also assuming that digital recorders can pick up spirits, then the s=
implest explanation is that that same up-front signal (before it gets digit=
ized into bits) is also being manipulated.  And an EMF source could theoret=
ically manipulate both the analog tape signal, and the digital tape signal.=


                  However, it may be that an EMF source strong enough to =
modify the signal would also effect all kinds of other things in the unit, =
including the final media itself.  It would be interesting for someone to d=
etermine what kind of external EMF is needed to induce or modify a signal i=
n the pre-digital phase of the recording circuitry, and what side effects t=
hat would have.  Depending on the result, it could either reveal other ways=
 to detect spirit influence, or prove that no spirit influence (via EMF) is=
 happening.



                  --- On Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <ap=
ril@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


                    From: Apri=
l Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
                    Su=
bject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
                    To: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups .com
                    Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 3:37 P=
M


                    =EF=BB=BF 

                    Gotcha. Thanks. I d=
o understand what you are saying. It does help to know these things.

     =
               Now how about with analog recorders. How would that work?

 =
                     ----- Original Message ----- 
                      Fr=
om: Rj 
                      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
               =
       Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 4:32 PM
                      Subject:=
 Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.


                            Your po=
ints seems to be that you can make it work without knowing how it works.  S=
o we need to talk about what you mean by that.

                           =
 When you use the microphone, you just speak, and let the recorder do the r=
est.  In this case, you are using the recorder without really knowing how i=
t works.   If a spirit can manipulate the EMF field around the AtoD convert=
er (even without using the mic), then they should be able to do the same: j=
ust use it without knowing how it works: the recorder does the rest.  In ne=
ither case do either of you need to know how it works, to get it to work. I=
 am not questioning this.

                            But, if they are goi=
ng to change the bits on the actual media themselves, then they must know h=
ow it works, it order to get all those bit-things I mentioned right.  The r=
ecorder can't "do the rest", because by changing the bits on the media them=
selves, they are going completely around what the recorder does, and doing =
the details themselves.  And as I said, the details there are very technica=
l, and include things like converting their words into digital samples of g=
roups of a specific number of bits in a specific format on specific places =
in specific orders with other specific other bits connected to them like fi=
le ownership and dates and such.  It is the job, basically, of a computer, =
not a person.

                            If they are changing the bits on=
 the media, then the recorder is not doing that.  They are no longer lettin=
g the recorder "do it", like you or they would be if they just used it norm=
ally.  The reason you can "make it work" without understanding it, is becau=
se the recorder is doing the work for you.  If they are to change the media=
 directly, then the recorder is no longer doing the work, and so they must =
understand all those digital issues.

                            So that i=
s the difference between being able to use it without understanding it, and=
 not being able to use it.



                            --- On Wed, 5/20/=
09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


     =
                         From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostre=
search. com>
                              Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I hav=
e a question.
                              To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
  =
                            Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 3:11 PM


      =
                        =EF=BB=BF 

                              My point =
was that they don't need to know how it works for it to work, like my analo=
gy of when I speak into a microphone. I don't know how that works, but it d=
oes regardless.

                              "And consider this: if the s=
pirit could make a normal tape recorder record by messing with the EMF fiel=
d near its mic, and it could make a digital recorder record by messing with=
 the EMF field neat its mic, why would the spirit even need to delve deeper=
 into the digital world: what worked for the analog tape recorder, still wo=
rks for the digital recorder, so why all the mindboggling extra effort for =
the same result?"

                              That's what I'm sayin' LOL=
! They wouldn't need know and it would still work.


                      =
        "Maybe it's that you don't know how a digital recorder works?  It r=
eally doesn't just dump a lot of "digitals" into a nice neat strip, akin to=
 how an analog tape recorder does to tape.  To record digitally takes many =
levels of processing, and a lot of careful digital choreography on the fina=
l media. "

                              I don't know how it works. But he=
re again, I don't have to know and it still works. I don't even know how ex=
actly an analog recorder works either. I have no clue how my voice can be t=
ransferred and recorded via electronic means. But again, I don't need to kn=
ow to make it work.


                              But I see what you are =
saying and this does make sense:

                              "It is much=
 more credible for the signal to be manipulated near the AtoD converter (wh=
ere EMF changes would have the most straighforward result) than in the digi=
tal media itself."

                              I never meant to insinuat=
e exactly how it could or couldn't work, only that true EVP is not created =
via sound waves in the environment. It has to be electromagnetically genera=
ted. From this statement is seems that's entirely verifiable.

            =
                  EVP has been found on analog recordings. Would this also =
hold true for that kind of media?




                                -----=
 Original Message ----- 
                                From: Rj 
        =
                        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                     =
           Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 3:13 PM
                          =
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.


                     =
           If the spirit doesn't know how to make it happen, then it's reas=
onable to assume that they are not making it happen.  It really does take a=
 lot of know-how.

                                And consider this: if th=
e spirit could make a normal tape recorder record by messing with the EMF f=
ield near its mic, and it could make a digital recorder record by messing w=
ith the EMF field neat its mic, why would the spirit even need to delve dee=
per into the digital world: what worked for the analog tape recorder, still=
 works for the digital recorder, so why all the mindboggling extra effort f=
or the same result?

                                Maybe it's that you do=
n't know how a digital recorder works?  It really doesn't just dump a lot o=
f "digitals" into a nice neat strip, akin to how an analog tape recorder do=
es to tape.  To record digitally takes many levels of processing, and a lot=
 of careful digital choreography on the final media.  \

                  =
              --- On Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh o=
stresearch. com> wrote:


                                From: April Aberc=
rombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
                             =
   Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
                          =
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                                Date: We=
dnesday, May 20, 2009, 1:56 PM


                                =EF=BB=BF =


                                I don't think they would have to know thi=
s to make it happen. We already know it happens and I bet that the spirit d=
oesn't know exactly how it accomplished it.

                              =
  Sure, there could be another factor that we just don't know about that ma=
kes EVP possible.

                                "It is much more credibl=
e for the signal to be manipulated near the AtoD converter (where EMF chang=
es would have the most straighforward result) than in the digital media its=
elf."

                                Ok well-there you have it.

        =
                        ----- Original Message ----- 
                     =
           From: Rj 
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s .com 
                                Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 2:24 =
PM
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a ques=
tion.



                                Manipulating EMF is one thing.  Bu=
t directly storing bits on a media is way beyond that.  Bits are not stored=
 in a continuous stream.  They are broken into bytes (little packets) that =
is totally controlled by the processor and software.  For Elvis to "encode =
directly" to the media, he would have to do what that software does to the =
digital signals coming in from the AtoD converter: he would have to group t=
he bits into (for example) 16 little herds each, decide on the specific bit=
 interpretation scheme (2's complement?) ,  find space on the media, update=
 the media's dictionary of where there is free space and where there isn't,=
 link the herds together with some sort of linked pointer, skip around the =
areas marked 'bad' on the media, update things like date/time modified and =
size, respect any kind of ownership permissions on the media, and so on.

 =
                               It is much more credible for the signal to b=
e manipulated near the AtoD converter (where EMF changes would have the mos=
t straighforward result) than in the digital media itself.

               =
                 --- On Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombieg=
h ostresearch. com> wrote:


                                From: April Ab=
ercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
                          =
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
                       =
         To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                                Date:=
 Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 1:05 PM


                                =EF=BB=
=BF 

                                "Probably not "directly", since that =
would mean grandma would have to have quite an understanding of digital enc=
oding, including which bits mean what, when, and where."

                 =
               Not necessarily- maybe it is that just by trying to communic=
ate through our equipment, it happens automatically. They don't have to rea=
lize that they are manipulating the EMF to make it occur, it just happens. =
It's the nature of being of pure energy.

                                -=
---- Original Message ----- 
                                From: Rj 
    =
                            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                 =
               Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 1:55 PM
                      =
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.



                =
                Probably not "directly", since that would mean grandma woul=
d have to have quite an understanding of digital encoding, including which =
bits mean what, when, and where.  But even on a digital recorder, there is =
still an analog element (the Analog to Digital converter) which takes the s=
ound pressure waves, as represented by some analog electronic detection ele=
ment, and converts that into digital.  That way, long departed uncle Ebenez=
er does not need to do anything digital.  Under this scenario, if sound is =
not being heard in the room, but is being induced into the circuitry, then =
it would be round about that AtoD converter (assuming it isn't other just p=
lain old noise in the digital elements).  

                               =
 Someone with more electronic know-how than me might be able to better pinp=
oint the area in the analog portion of that AtoD pipeline where it would be=
 most likely it could be influenced by, say, an EM field, and that would al=
so occur in a normal analog tape recorder.

                               =
  
                                --- On Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <=
april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


                            =
    From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
        =
                        Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
     =
                           To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                   =
             Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 12:29 PM



                   =
             This is what I think true EVP is Eric. Not and actual sound em=
itting a sound wave in the environment, but EMF manipulation in order to im=
print the message directly to the recording media. It doesn't matter if it =
is analog or digital.

                                If the sound that is=
 recorded emitted a sound wave in the physical environment, then it is real=
ly a disembodied voice, and not true EVP.

                                =
----- Original Message ----- 
                                From: Eric Va=
nDuzer 
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
     =
                           Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 11:16 AM
         =
                       Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.


    =
                            Actually that I would buy into  But the questio=
n I have when you say "tape" are you talking old analog tape or digi record=
ing.  Here is the reason I believe it can be do "real-time".  As you all kn=
ow we use electromagnetic Field detectors in field investigations.  If a sp=
irit can manipulate that with to show that they are there by giving off a E=
M field whose to say they can't manipulate a magnetic strip of a tape or ev=
en the electronics in a Digi recorder to speak in "real-time".



         =
                       On Wed, May 20, 2009 at 1:01 PM, Kristin Morris <ckm=
orris95@sbcgloba l.net> wrote:





                                Okay I =
have another one for you to think about.. I tape a session and review it la=
ter..  even a day later.  Upon review the message that comes over is about =
something that =E2=80=98just happened=E2=80=99 while I was reviewing or hap=
pened after taping?  Is it possible that spirit can manipulate the recordin=
g AFTER recording has stopped or even manipulate the audio while reviewing?=




                                An give you an example of this I was re=
cording one day and I reviewed the audio the next day.  While reviewing =E2=
=80=93 about half way through =E2=80=93 the message =E2=80=9CYour mother is=
 calling=E2=80=9D was found.  I saved it and moved on and within two second=
s my mom called.  You say it is a coincidence except that I hadn=E2=80=99t =
spoken to my mother in over a year.  During this same conversation with her=
 =E2=80=93 we sorta made amends and I told her the story of the =E2=80=98se=
cret=E2=80=99 I had found out about a family member having a child out of w=
edlock in the late 1920s.  Quick backstory.. I found out about this out-of-=
wedlock birth through my genealogy research and contacted spirit through th=
e box and I was promptly told to keep it secret and which I promised to do=
=E2=80=A6



                                Well in this conversation with=
 my mom after not speaking for a year I told her what I had found out.  Whe=
n the telephone conversation ended with my mom=E2=80=A6 I was amazed that t=
he recording had told me she would call right be fore she did =E2=80=93 eve=
n though the audio was recorded the previous day.  I proceeded to go back t=
o reviewing the audio and the very first thing I heard was:  THAT WAS SUPPO=
SED TO BE A SECRET =E2=80=93 YOU LIED.



                                M=
aybe they can manipulate =E2=80=98real-time=E2=80=99 literally??? ?



    =
                            k




-----------------------------------------=
-------

                                From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com [ma=
ilto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com] On Behalf Of April Abercrombie
             =
                   Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 11:36 AM 


              =
                  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com

                           =
     Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.














          =
                      2 different things happening-that' s why. When you ge=
t EVP that everyone understands,  it is outward, in the environment. Not a =
communication through subconscious means.



                              =
  EVP that people swear they hear, but noone else can make sense, may be a =
message to them via subconscious means. That isn't to say that ALL EVP's li=
ke this are true messages, I am sure alot are just matrixing.



          =
                      But then that is how the art of scrying starts-matrix=
ing. Like the Rorschach tests. The images you matrix with those gives the p=
sychologist an insight into your mind.



                                B=
y gazing into a dark, reflective surface, you start to see cloudy images. A=
t first, you will just be matrixing faces in the clouds and not getting muc=
h substance. Try it, you will see what I am saying. With practice, you star=
t to see clear, concise images.



                                I think =
that is what happening with audio as well.



                             =
   We already know for a fact pareidolia can occur in audio as well as visu=
al stimulus.

- 

                                From: Eric VanDuzer 

                 =
               To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 

                             =
   Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 10:19 AM

                                =
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.



                          =
      yes I understand its personal to that particular individual but why c=
an't I hear it.  I have gotten some very personal EVPs through the traditio=
nal investigation way (not through a box or anything of that matter) that a=
ll others have heard.

                                On Wed, May 20, 2009=
 at 12:15 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrot=
e:



                                "If one person is not meant to hear i=
t they won't hear it (I guess I am not quite ready to believe that one righ=
t yet)." 



                                I don't know for sure about th=
at one either, but I am not ready to discount it either, especially since I=
 stumbled across the possibility of audible scrying. But I am sure alot of =
people don't believe in scrying at all either.



                         =
       What makes it a possibility to me is that so many people are hearing=
 things that are very personal, but stuff they would not have come up with =
on their own.





                                ----- Original Message -=
---- 

                                From: Eric VanDuzer 

              =
                  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 

                          =
      Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 10:09 AM

                             =
   Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.



                       =
         I think that is the problem I am having though Jim.  When you say =
"work them over till you hear them"  to me I should not have to work them o=
ver till I hear them.  Yes taking out the ambient and background noise is o=
ne thing.  But if you just keep on listening to them with different enhance=
ments you are bound to hear something (matrixing).  If one person is not me=
ant to hear it they won't hear it (I guess I am not quite ready to believe =
that one right yet).  I think you all know what I am getting at.  

       =
                         On Tue, May 19, 2009 at 9:11 PM, James W. Hyslope =
<clockdryve@yahoo. com> wrote:



                                Well, for=
 myself...I don't "clean" them up to much because I really don't know HOW :=
) (well a little bit)Since I've only been at it for a couple weeks. BUT if =
you can clean up something to where you can FIND what was there to begin wi=
th "you have done no harm" I hear alot more than others I guess, and I have=
n't enhanced many of my evp's.*If anyone is able to clean them up...I DO pr=
omise you will hear what I say is correct)Pretty BOLD statement, but if you=
 are able to clean it up with better software (please do for others too) I =
will be more than happy to "listen" where I made a mistake...I can only LEA=
RN from it :) I have done some DEEP enhancements to a few of my evp's...fro=
m the begining I could only hear clicks and thumps.....but after messing wi=
th that area, eventually I would hear the true voices (and can tell if male=
 or female...approximat e age) and understand the mood also....these where =
extreamly modified, and I feel that I could NOT have added enough "simple" =
enhancements that would ADD a voice....full of emotion and distinct syllabl=
es :) And some just can't hear them for what ever reason be it equipment th=
at is used to hear (pc-headphones- speakers- ears) know one has the perfect=
 match of all these things. Check out "Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" in the files se=
ction....work them over till you hear them. I really can't do much more :)-=

                           >
                                > Now I may be=
 biased to the "investigation" way of doing things. I do clean
            =
                    > up evps if I hear something and can't make it out do =
to ambient noise. So
                                > hear is my question.=
 When do you stop cleaning up? Wouldn't to much
                           =
     > enhancing "taint" the results? To me the more enhancing you do the l=
ess
                                > convincing it becomes. I hope noone f=
inds this offensive, it is not meant
                                > to b=
e I am just really curious. The way I look at it is that if you have to
   =

here really something there to
                                > begin with=
. Are we just making ourselves believe there is something there??

                <TD vAlign=3Dtop><B=
R>I'm not trying to say I know how a spirit 
                  could record=
 on an analog recorder, or if they can at all: my 
                  point =
was that it wasn't reasonable to assume it could 
                  directl=
y change the bits on digital media and wind up with 
                  anyt=
hing usable.<BR><BR>But, were I to conjecture, one might 
                 =
 say that the air pressure of a voice is converted to a signal 
           =
       that modifies the magnetic properties of a tape.  And a 
      =
            line recording uses a signal, not from the mic, but from some 
=
                  other source, to do the same.  So if that signal wer=
e to 
                  be manipulated via external EMF, it would change th=
e final 
                  result on the tape.  <BR><BR>Since we are a=
lso assuming 
                  that digital recorders can pick up spirits,=
 then the simplest 
                  explanation is that that same up-fron=
t signal (before it gets 
                  digitized into bits) is also be=
ing manipulated.  And an 
                  EMF source could theoretic=
ally manipulate both the analog tape 
                  signal, and the dig=
ital tape signal.<BR><BR>However, it may be 
                  that an EMF =
source strong enough to modify the signal would 
                  also eff=
ect all kinds of other things in the unit, including 
                  the=
 final media itself.  It would be interesting for 
                  s=
omeone to determine what kind of external EMF is needed to 
               =
   induce or modify a signal in the pre-digital phase of the 
             =
     recording circuitry, and what side effects that would 
               =
   have.  Depending on the result, it could either reveal 
           =
       other ways to detect spirit influence, or prove that no spirit 
    =
              influence (via EMF) is happening.<BR><BR><BR><BR>--- On 
    =

                          <TD vAlign=3Dtop>Yo=
ur points seems to be that you can 
                            make it wor=
k without knowing how it works.  So 
                            we ne=
ed to talk about what you mean by 
                            that.<BR><BR=
>When you use the microphone, you just 
                            speak, =
and let the recorder do the rest.  In 
                            thi=
s case, you are using the recorder without really 
                        =
    knowing how it works.   If a spirit can 
                         =
   manipulate the EMF field around the AtoD converter 
                    =
        (even without using the mic), then they should be 
                =
            able to do the same: just use it without knowing how 
         =
                   it works: the recorder does the rest.  In 
        =
                    neither case do either of you need to know how it 
    =
                        works, to get it to work. I am not questioning 
   =
                         this.<BR><BR>But, if they are going to change the =

                            bits on the actual media themselves, then they=
 must 
                            know how it works, it order to get all t=
hose 
                            bit-things I mentioned right.  The r=
ecorder 
                            can't "do the rest", because by changi=
ng the bits on 
                            the media themselves, they are =
going completely 
                            around what the recorder does=
, and doing the details 
                            themselves.  And =
as I said, the details there 
                            are very technica=
l, and include things like 
                            converting their wo=
rds into digital samples of 
                            groups of a specif=
ic number of bits in a specific 
                            format on spec=
ific places in specific orders with 
                            other spec=
ific other bits connected to them like 
                            file ow=
nership and dates and such.  It is the 
                            jo=
b, basically, of a computer, not a 
                            person.<BR>=
<BR>If they are changing the bits on the 
                            media=
, then the recorder is not doing that.  
                            T=
hey are no longer letting the recorder "do it", 
                          =
  like you or they would be if they just used it 
                         =
   normally.  The reason you can "make it work" 
                     =
       without understanding it, is because the recorder is 
              =
              doing the work for you.  If they are to change 
        =
                    the media directly, then the recorder is no longer 
   =
                         doing the work, and so they must understand all 
 =
                           those digital issues.<BR><BR>So that is the 
   =
                         difference between being able to use it without 
 =
                           understanding it, and not being able to use 
   =
                         it.<BR><BR><BR><BR>--- On <B>Wed, 5/20/09, April

way beyond that.  Bits are not 
                                stored=
 in a continuous stream.  They are 
                                br=
oken into bytes (little packets) that is 
                                t=
otally controlled by the processor and 
                                sof=
tware.  For Elvis to "encode directly" 
                              =
  to the media, he would have to do what that 
                            =
    software does to the digital signals coming in 
                       =
         from the AtoD converter: he would have to group 
                 =
               the bits into (for example) 16 little herds 
               =
                 each, decide on the specific bit interpretation 
         =
                       scheme (2's complement?) ,  find space on 
    =
                            the media, update the media's dictionary of 
  =
                              where there is free space and where there isn=
't, 
                                link the herds together with some sort=
 of linked 
                                pointer, skip around the areas =
marked 'bad' on 
                                the media, update things l=
ike date/time modified 
                                and size, respect a=
ny kind of ownership 
                                permissions on the me=
dia, and so on.<BR><BR>It 
                                is much more cre=
dible for the signal to be 
                                manipulated nea=
r the AtoD converter (where EMF 
                                changes wo=
uld have the most straighforward 
                                result) t=
han in the digital media 
                                itself.<BR><BR>--=

           <TD vAlign=3Dtop><BR>Probably not "directly", 
                 =
               since that would mean grandma would have to have 
          =
                      quite an understanding of digital encoding, 
        =
                        including which bits mean what, when, and 
        =
                        where.  But even on a digital recorder, 
     =
                           there is still an analog element (the Analog to =

                                Digital converter) which takes the sound 
=
                                pressure waves, as represented by some anal=
og 
                                electronic detection element, and conve=
rts that 
                                into digital.  That way, lon=
g departed 
                                uncle Ebenezer does not need to=
 do anything 
                                digital.  Under this sce=
nario, if sound is 
                                not being heard in the =
room, but is being 
                                induced into the circui=
try, then it would be 
                                round about that Ato=
D converter (assuming it 
                                isn't other just =
plain old noise in the digital 
                                elements).&=
